source.class:
HttpContext represents a mapping between the root URI path of an application to a {@link HttpHandler} which is invoked to handle requests destined for that path on the associated HttpServer or HttpsServer.

HttpContext instances are created by the create methods in HttpServer and HttpsServer

A chain of {@link Filter} objects can be added to a HttpContext. All exchanges processed by the context can be pre- and post-processed by each Filter in the chain. 1.6 returns the handler for this context the HttpHandler for this context Sets the handler for this context, if not already set. h the handler to set for this context IllegalArgumentException if this context's handler is already set. NullPointerException if handler is null returns the path this context was created with this context's path returns the server this context was created with this context's server returns a mutable Map, which can be used to pass configuration and other data to Filter modules and to the context's exchange handler.

Every attribute stored in this Map will be visible to every HttpExchange processed by this context returns this context's list of Filters. This is the actual list used by the server when dispatching requests so modifications to this list immediately affect the the handling of exchanges. Sets the Authenticator for this HttpContext. Once an authenticator is establised on a context, all client requests must be authenticated, and the given object will be invoked to validate each request. Each call to this method replaces any previous value set. auth the authenticator to set. If null then any previously set authenticator is removed, and client authentication will no longer be required. the previous Authenticator, if any set, or null otherwise. Returns the currently set Authenticator for this context if one exists. this HttpContext's Authenticator, or null if none is set.
